intro: Xylobium carnosum, commonly known as the fleshy waxplant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Xylobium carnosum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to arid environments.
